#SSL Security rating A?  Why not A+?
Mozilla Foundation uses Amazon AWS, and their ELB load balancers.  Up until this last week, we had an A rating for SSL security from [ssllabs](https://www.ssllabs.com/ssltest/analyze.html), which was pretty darn good.  Having noted that AWS had enabled perfect forward secrecy ciphers recently, I updated my co-worker Gene's [python AWS elb cipher update script](https://github.com/mozilla/identity-ops/pull/150) to include ECDHE.
Now...
